basics.name: Nate Clark
basics.label: Full-stack Javascript Jedi / Nate of All Trades
basics.summary: A full-stack engineer developer/mentor/blogger with 15+ years experience building scalable web applications and a passion for learning.

work.summary: Help clients, big and a small achieve their goals in the most efficient way possible. Apply my experience through collaboration and shared learning.
highlights: Promoter of functional programming. Trained several teams to use Ramda/Lodash fp
Built out a greenfield UX for a piece of proprietary hardware from conception to customer delivery
Implemented SSR using NextJs to provide a fast, SEO friendly user experience
Drove patterns and best practices at each client
Leveraged pairing as a tool to level up fellow developers
Shared strong opinions while being receptive to change
Enforced WCAG / ADA compliance as table stakes
Acted as a catalyst to positive change on every project
: React, Node, GraphQL, NextJs, Razzle, Material UI, ExpressJs, Postgres, Docker, Ramda, Typescript

work.summary: Built a modern event managment system to streamline volunteer placement that is actively used by several pro sports venues including FirstEnergy Stadium, Paul Brown Stadium, and Quicken Loans Arena
highlights: Mastered React as a static frontend with a GraphQL backend
From UI to DB. Implemented entire AWS stack solution hosting an enterprise level application
Harnessed the opportunity to leverage all the automation and code quality tools of my choosing
Static React/Apollo driven frontend hosted via CloudFront cdn
Learned and implemented GraphQL queries, mutations and deployed on AWS ECS
Docker all the things. Local dev, dev env, and prod all leverage the same docker containers
Implemented entire CI/CD pipeline with blue/green deployments
: React, Node, GraphQL, AWS, CircleCi, Docker, Auth0

work.summary: Worked with seed investor to convert an original idea into a functioning online application
highlights: Lead a small, but extremely competent team to wrangle product ideas into real requirements
Learned how to best communicate with the product team to manage expectations
: React, Node, MeteorJs, ExpressJs, Postgres

work.position: Full-stack Developer / Team Lead / Remote worker
work.summary: Responsible for a contractor team, leading the development of multiple React / NodeJs driven applications and services.
highlights: Helped bring existing ecommerce site into WCAG / ADA compliance
Worked directly with Under Armour development teams on their ecommerce site, underarmour.com
Contributed to a vast Javascript ecosystem and actively deployed changes to production through CI/CD pipepline
In addition to task work, also performed code reviews and assisted team with architecture decisions
Implemented Slack bots to automate status and pull request reports
Contributed to Apple Pay integration project
Gained familiarity with React patterns and practices on an already very familiar understanding of client/server js
Fully committed to remote work and the communication surrounding that environment
: React, Node, GraphQL

work.summary: Responsible for several micro teams, leading the development of multiple Angular / NodeJs driven applications.
highlights: Strong background in Javascript using the following frameworks AngularJs, NodeJs, ExpressJs, Bootstrap
Implemented the conversion of legacy applications to Angular driven SPA
Conducted several Angular and NodeJs bootcamps for junior developers. Prefer to show others how rather than telling them to figure it out.
Provided boilerplate Node.Js project that stood as the foundation for all new development
Introduced html and css precompilers to improve both quality and remove bloat
Wrapped development build process and deploys into a pretty little bow with Grunt/Gulp
Responsible for rapid proof of concept and prototyping of mocks for Product evaluation
DRY code evangelist
Directed a geographically dispersed team of web developers
Advocate micro service architecture. Do one thing simply and efficiently
Participate in upfront design meetings: brainstorming, gathering requirements, white-boarding
Interface with graphic designers and developers to streamline work and ensure delivery of design vision
Establish design and usability patterns for team
Address usability concerns early on in SDLC
Led the charge (and won the war) for the strict support of evergreen browsers only
Successfully delivered 3 core application redesigns with micro teams and equivalently small timelines
: Angular, AngularJs, NodeJs, ExpressJs, Twitter Bootstrap, Postgres

work.summary: C#, ASP.Net web developer driving UI refresh of fordparts.com
highlights: Manage proxy between services and front end
Provide asynchronous means of data refreshing
Core contributor to fordparts.com
Implemented several third party jQuery plugins to achieve a modern interface
: ASP.NET, MSSQL, Rest APIs, JQuery

work.summary: Database development including scripting, stored procedure generation, data structure creation and optimization.
highlights: Optimizing/creating the CRUD procedures for service developers
Providing a tsql style guide and enforced the use of it
Introduced patterns and practices that saved DBAs time and effort during deployments
: MSSQL, Team Foundation Server

work.company: Healthcare Consulting Benefits Review (acquired by Xerox)
work.summary: Small insurance consulting company DBA and WinForms developer.
highlights: Responsible for audit platform that lead to the company being purchased by Xerox in 2006
Data-mined and queried large data sets to find financial loss patterns
Coupled database work with a WinForm application to visually display points of interest
Integrated SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services)
: VB.Net, MSSQL

publications.name: Developer Dark Arts (series)
publications.summary: A blog series dedicated to some anti-patterns and solutions for them

publications.name: Debug as Code
publications.summary: How your debugging statements should be long lived in your implementations

publications.name: Public Repos
publications.summary: All of my side projects, musings, and outside 9-5 work

interests.name: What is Nate learning right now?
